channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8209595] MonitorVmStartTerminate.java timed out
item.description:
The following test timed out with jdk-11+26 slowdebug bits on Linux-X64:

sun/jvmstat/monitor/MonitoredVm/MonitorVmStartTerminate.java

Here is a snippet of the log file:

----------System.out:(24/5147)----------
started=0, terminated=0
Starting c16b73a5-8737-46d5-832a-af4e6969805f_0
Starting c16b73a5-8737-46d5-832a-af4e6969805f_1
Starting c16b73a5-8737-46d5-832a-af4e6969805f_2
Starting c16b73a5-8737-46d5-832a-af4e6969805f_3
Starting c16b73a5-8737-46d5-832a-af4e6969805f_4
Starting c16b73a5-8737-46d5-832a-af4e6969805f_5
Starting c16b73a5-8737-46d5-832a-af4e6969805f_6
Starting c16b73a5-8737-46d5-832a-af4e6969805f_7
Starting c16b73a5-8737-46d5-832a-af4e6969805f_8
Starting c16b73a5-8737-46d5-832a-af4e6969805f_9
Waiting for all processes to get started notification
Command line: [/work/shared/bug_hunt/thread_SMR_stress/jdk11_exp/build/linux-x86_64-normal-server-slowdebug/images/jdk/bin/java -Dtest.timeout.factor=12.0 -cp /work/shared/bug_hunt/thread_SMR_stress/jdk11_exp/build/linux-x86_64-normal-server-slowdebug/test-support/jtreg_open_test_jdk_jdk_svc/classes/10/sun/jvmstat/monitor/MonitoredVm/MonitorVmStartTerminate.d MonitorVmStartTerminate$JavaProcess c16b73a5-8737-46d5-832a-af4e6969805f_0 ]

<snip>

Command line: [/work/shared/bug_hunt/thread_SMR_stress/jdk11_exp/build/linux-x86_64-normal-server-slowdebug/images/jdk/bin/java -Dtest.timeout.factor=12.0 -cp /work/shared/bug_hunt/thread_SMR_stress/jdk11_exp/build/linux-x86_64-normal-server-slowdebug/test-support/jtreg_open_test_jdk_jdk_svc/classes/10/sun/jvmstat/monitor/MonitoredVm/MonitorVmStartTerminate.d MonitorVmStartTerminate$JavaProcess c16b73a5-8737-46d5-832a-af4e6969805f_9 ]
Command line: [/work/shared/bug_hunt/thread_SMR_stress/jdk11_exp/build/linux-x86_64-normal-server-slowdebug/images/jdk/bin/java -Dtest.timeout.factor=12.0 -cp /work/shared/bug_hunt/thread_SMR_stress/jdk11_exp/build/linux-x86_64-normal-server-slowdebug/test-support/jtreg_open_test_jdk_jdk_svc/classes/10/sun/jvmstat/monitor/MonitoredVm/MonitorVmStartTerminate.d MonitorVmStartTerminate$JavaProcess c16b73a5-8737-46d5-832a-af4e6969805f_7 ]
Timeout refired 1440 times
----------System.err:(0/0)----------
----------rerun:(35/4308)*----------


This test timed out in 1 of 3 'slowdebug' bits test runs
and did not fail with any 'release' or 'fastdebug' bits runs
(1 timeout in 9 runs) so I'm marking this bug as 'intermittent'.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
[jdk11u-fix-request] Approval Request from Amos
“Backporting for parity with jdk 11.0.23-oracle. No risk, test fix. Clean backport. SAP nightlies passed on 2024-01-25,26”

[jdk17u-fix-request] Approval Request from Amos
“Backporting for parity with jdk 17.0.11-oracle. No risk, test fix. Clean backport. SAP nightlies passed on 2024-01-25”

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk11u-dev/pull/2475
Date: 2024-01-23 06:24:23 +0000

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk17u-dev/pull/2160
Date: 2024-01-23 05:49:06 +0000

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk21u-dev/pull/65
Date: 2023-12-18 14:49:52 +0000

Fix request [21u]

I backport this to keep the 21u test suite up-to-date. This will simplify future test backports.
No risk, only a test change.
Clean backport.
Test passes. SAP nightly testing passed.
The fix for this bug is integrated in jdk-22+21-1609.

Changeset: a045258a
Author: Kevin Walls <kevinw@openjdk.org>
Date: 2023-10-20 16:38:39 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/a045258ae2eb02daa17a9a9799a666f42daa7e20

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/16077
Date: 2023-10-06 19:10:50 +0000

When hanging, the JavaProcess.main test processes are always observed in takeNap, in each of 5 thread dumps for the 10 processes.
We know it's looping as there are about 10,000 lines of e.g.
Waiting for e2312be1-1450-4176-b911-bc17e75ce2e4_5 to be removed, 379862977 ns

So the files are not being removed, which should be done in the javaProcess.terminate() method.

We see "Waiting for all processes to get started notification", from:

 96 // Wait for all processes to start before terminating
 97 // them, so pids are not reused within a poll interval.
 98 System.out.println("Waiting for all processes to get started notification"); <---- seen
 99 listener.started.acquire(PROCESS_COUNT); <---- blocking until all 10 are available
100
101 for (JavaProcess javaProcess : javaProcesses) {
102 javaProcess.terminate(); <--- THIS would wait for file to exist, and deletes the file
103 }
104 System.out.println("Waiting for all processes to get terminated notification"); <---- NOT seen


PROCESS_COUNT = 10
BUT we only see "started=9, terminated=0"
BUT we have 10 thread dumps in "MonitorVmStartTerminate$JavaProcess.takeNap(MonitorVmStartTerminate.java:252)"
The test processes exist, but somebody didn't check in.

Listener implements HostListener (src/jdk.internal.jvmstat/share/classes/sun/jvmstat/monitor/event/HostListener.java)

releaseStarted method calls started.release(), and is called by:

Listener::vmStatusChanged() Invoked when the status of Java Virtual Machine changes.

releaseStarted calls:
releaseStarted(event.getStarted()): i.e. Set<Integer> of JVMs started since last event notif.
for all IDs, call releaseStarted(id)
which iterates the known JavaProcesses
if it hasMainArgs(),
set the javapocess id, print RELEASED, and call started.release()


We are NOT calling started.release for one of them, but do see a pid for the missing process, so, the hasMainArgs call must have failed.

Here's a log file snippet from the jdk-22+4-289-tier5 sighting:

sun/jvmstat/monitor/MonitoredVm/MonitorVmStartTerminate.java

#section:main
----------messages:(9/531)----------
command: main MonitorVmStartTerminate
reason: User specified action: run main/othervm MonitorVmStartTerminate
started: Thu Jun 29 17:45:04 UTC 2023
Mode: othervm [/othervm specified]
Additional options from @modules: --add-modules java.management,jdk.internal.jvmstat --add-exports jdk.internal.jvmstat/sun.jvmstat.monitor=ALL-UNNAMED --add-exports jdk.internal.jvmstat/sun.jvmstat.monitor.event=ALL-UNNAMED
Timeout information:
--- Timeout information end.
finished: Thu Jun 29 18:04:37 UTC 2023
elapsed time (seconds): 1172.633
----------configuration:(5/223)----------
Boot Layer
  add modules: java.management jdk.internal.jvmstat
  add exports: jdk.internal.jvmstat/sun.jvmstat.monitor ALL-UNNAMED
               jdk.internal.jvmstat/sun.jvmstat.monitor.event ALL-UNNAMED

----------System.out:(2216/71536)----------
started=0, terminated=0
Starting 29677be1-a701-4526-b1dd-6ae3ab068685_0
Starting 29677be1-a701-4526-b1dd-6ae3ab068685_1

Starting 29677be1-a701-4526-b1dd-6ae3ab068685_3

Starting 29677be1-a701-4526-b1dd-6ae3ab068685_5

result: Error. Program `/opt/mach5/mesos/work_dir/jib-master/install/jdk-22+4-289/linux-aarch64-debug.jdk/jdk-22/fastdebug/bin/java' timed out (timeout set to 480000ms, elapsed time including timeout handling was 1172622ms).

These failures are quite rare. Looking at mach5, I see 9 failures in the last 3 years, plus 2 personal job failures. All platforms - linux, windows, mac. Both x64 and aarch64.

In the bad runs, a PID appears in the "realeaseStarted" (should be "releaseStarted") list of VMs, but we never print "RELEASED...".
i.e. the Listener gets the Integer id of VMs that have started, including all the VMs it should care about. But it fails to recognise one of them as being in its JavaProcess List.

e.g.
Here, pid 15062 is in the Set of VM ids we receive a notification for, but we never print "RELEASED"...

[2019-07-06T05:08:39.073862Z] Gathering output for process 15063
[2019-07-06T05:08:39.080295Z] Gathering output for process 15061
[2019-07-06T05:08:39.074189Z] Gathering output for process 15059

[2019-07-06T05:08:39.073899Z] Gathering output for process 15055
[2019-07-06T05:08:39.074208Z] Gathering output for process 15058

...it must have been 5351209d-5821-470f-b4db-c5b111922608_1 which failed to be recognised.

The test method hasMainArgs() calls getMonitoredVm and checks the main args of the target. Could be a possbility of rare failure here.

Linux failures have multiple coredumps in the artifacts. No obvious fault, just a SIGABRT, I think these are from being killed off due to timeout.
reproduced on Windows - see JDK-8224886

I spotted this failure in my stress testing for 8153224 on Linux-X64.
